choices.B: Run a sniffer on the web server.

Refer to the exhibits.
Exhibit A.
//IMG//

Exhibit B.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows the configuration for the SD-WAN member, Performance SLA, and SD-WAN Rule, as well as the output of diagnose sys virtual-wan- link health-check.
Which interface will be selected as an outgoing interface?

discussion.content: It's Port 2. Port 3 and 4 have packet loss so they are eliminated. Port 1 and Port 2 have no packet loss but because the strategy is Lower Qost the tie breaker is qost number. The lowest cost number will be selected.

comments.content: in SLA_1 a packet loss treshhold of 0% is configured, so port 4 don't pass the SLA
But SLA is set to lowest cost and not best quality.. port4 has lowest cost and is available.

Ok, I take it back, SLA target still counts:
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.2.3/administration-guide/342836/lowest-cost-sla-strategy
Port 4 is alive, so it passed SLA_1, port4 is correct.
Was thinking the same since the packet loss threshold is set to 0%, which rules port4 out for me.

discussion.content: Should this not be port 2 ? Port 4 and Port 3 not selected due to packet loss, Port 1 has higher cost. Leaving port 2.
clearly port-2. Why did i pay for this when most of the answers are wrong?!

Selected Answer: A
port2 because it has no packet loss and lowest cost available

Selected Answer: A
The interface that meets SLA targets is selected. When there is a tie, the interface with the lowest assigned cost is selected.
FortiGate_Infrastructure_7.0_Study_Guide-Online – page 95
First must passed the target, after pass the cost y finally pass interface preference
port2 in my Opinion aswell

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A.

To determine the best path for traffic in Fortinet's SD-WAN implementation, a "lowest cost" algorithm is used that considers the cost metric associated with each available WAN link. In this case, Port 4 and 3 are eliminated due to packet loss, leaving Port 1 and Port 2 as the available paths.

The next stage of elimination is based on the highest cost. Port 1 has a high cost of 15, which makes it less desirable than Port 2. Therefore, Port 1 is eliminated, and Port 2 is selected as the winner.

For more information, please refer to the Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide, page 95.

Selected Answer: A
Lower Cost (SLA) SLA Targets->Cost->Interface Preference. Fortigate Infrastructure 7.0 Study Guide, page 95

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Does 0% is really 0.000000%? Does not mean less than 1% (<1%). Because if even a decimal above 0 means SLA is not met then in a real scenario is always going to be flapping.

Entre ellos (o si ninguno cumple SLA) se elige el que tenga mejor coste o en último caso según orden de configuración.

choices.D: RPF is a mechanism that protects FortiGate and your network from IP spoofing attacks.
choices.C: The RPF check is run on the first sent and reply packet of any new session.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the RPF check? (Choose two.)
Which three pieces of information does FortiGate use to identify the hostname of the SSL server when SSL certificate inspection is enabled? (Choose three.)

choices.D: The server name indication (SNI) extension in the client hello message
choices.E: The host field in the HTTP header
choices.C: The serial number in the server certificate
choices.A: The subject field in the server certificate
choices.B: The subject alternative name (SAN) field in the server certificate

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
FG Security 7.0 pag 326

Selected Answer: ABD
During the exchange of hello messages at the beginning of an SSL handshake, FortiGate parses server name indication (SNI) from client Hello, which is an extension of the TLS protocol. 
The SNI tells FortiGate the hostname of the SSL server, which is validated against the DNS name before receipt of the server certificate. 
If there is no SNI exchanged, then FortiGate identifies the server by the value in the Subject field or SAN (subject alternative name) field in the server certificate.
